    "name": "Numbers of the form (4^k - 4)/k.",
    "comment": [
        "Subsequence of A246445.",
        "Generated by k = 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 11, 12, 13, 15, 17, 19, 23, 28, 29, 31,...",
        "This set of k contains all elements of A122781 and all primes. [The primes because j^p == j mod (p) for every integer j if p is primej; see e.g. the corollary 4.4 to the Lagrange theorem in Jones et al]"
    ],
    "link": [
        "G. A. Jones, J. M. Jones, <a href=\"http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4471-0613-5_4\">Congruences with  a prime-power modulus</a>, p 65-82 in \"Elementary Number Theory\", Springer Undergraduate Mathematics Series, (1988)."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(9) = 1398101 because (4^12 - 4)/12 = 1398101 for k = 12."
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) lista(nn) = {for (k=1, nn, va = (4^k - 4)/k; if (type(va) == \"t_INT\", print1(va, \", \")););} \\\\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 12 2014"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A020136, A064535, A122781, A246445, A247033."
    ],
